TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder
Class SegmentCode2D

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERcoder.SegmentCoder.SegmentCode2D

public class SegmentCode2D
extends java.lang.Object

This class encode the segment according to the given parameters. Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run
  get functions

Version:
1.2
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

Field Detail

initialCodedDC

BitStream[] initialCodedDC
This array stores for each gaggle the initial coding of DC quantized components

refinementDC

BitStream[][] refinementDC
This array stores for each gaggle and bitplane the refinement of DC components

recommendedRefinementAC

BitStream[][][][] recommendedRefinementAC
This array stores for each gaggle, bitplane, block and resolution level the refinement of AC components refinementAC[gaggle][bitPlane][block][resolutionLevel]

terRefinementAC

BitStream[][][] terRefinementAC
This array stores for each gaggle, bitplane, block and resolution level the refinement of AC components refinementAC[gaggle][bitPlane][resolutionLevel]

codedBitDepthACBlock

BitStream[] codedBitDepthACBlock
This array stores for each gaggle the encoded bit depth of AC components of each block

sortingAC

BitStream[][][] sortingAC
This array stores for each gaggle, bitplane and resolution level the encoded significance of AC components of the segment encodedSegmentAC[gaggle][bitPlane][resolutionLevel]

parametersSet

boolean parametersSet
To know if parameters are set.

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

imageSamples

float[][] imageSamples
Channel samples (index meaning [y][x]).

All values allowed.

WTLevels

int WTLevels
Definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTLevels

WTType

int WTType
Definition in ForwardWaveletTransform.WTTypes

customWtFlag

int customWtFlag
Definition in ForwardWeighting.customWtFlag

customWeight

float[] customWeight
Definition in ForwardWeighting.customWeight

blockInSegment

int[] blockInSegment
This array determines which blocks belong to each segment, i.e. which is its position in the channel

bitDepthAC

int bitDepthAC
This integer determines the number of bits needed to represent the magnitude of AC components in the segment.

Valid values are positive values

bitDepthACBlock

int[] bitDepthACBlock
This array determines, for each block, the number of bits needed to represent the magnitude of AC components

bitDepthDC

int bitDepthDC
This integer determines the number of bits needed to represent DC components in two-complement representation.

Valid values are positive values.

blocksPerSegment

int blocksPerSegment
Indicates the number of blocks contained in each segment. If the value exceeds the number of blocks remaining to be encoded in a component, the number of remaining blocks will be asigned to blocksPerSegment.

Valid values are integers between 1 and Math.pow(2,20) encoded mod(Math.pow(2,20))

optDCSelect

int[] optDCSelect
Specifies the method employed to select value of k parameters when coding DC quantized components

Valid values are:

  • 0 - Recommended heuristic selection
  • 1 - Optimum (exhaustive) selection
  • 2 - Cristina's heuristic selection
  • 3 - Fernando's heuristic selection

optACSelect

int[] optACSelect
Specifies the method employed to select value of k parameters when coding BitDepthAC_Block

Valid values are:

  • 0 - Recommended heuristic selection
  • 1 - Optimum (exhaustive) selection
  • 2 - Cristina's heuristic selection
  • 3 - Fernando's heuristic selection

gaggleDCSize

int[] gaggleDCSize
Specifies the size of a gaggle of DC components for each segment

Valid values are positive values.

gaggleACSize

int[] gaggleACSize
Specifies the size of a gaggle of AC components for each segment

Valid values are positive values.

idDC

int[] idDC
Specifies the frequency of appareance of id DC in the segment. That means, how often a id DC appears

Valid values are positive values. 0 value means that only one id DC is used in the segment.

idAC

int[] idAC
Specifies the frequency of appareance of id AC in the segment. That means, how often a id AC appears

Valid values are positive values. 0 value means that only one id AC is used in the segment.

segmentId

int segmentId
Specificies the segment in the coded image;

segByteLimit

int[] segByteLimit
Indicates the maximum number of bytes that can be employed to encode a segment.

Negatives values are not allowed.

DCStop

int[] DCStop
Indicates for each segment if codification must stop after DC initially encoding

Valid values are:

  • 0 - No stop
  • 1 - Stop after coding DC quantized components

bitPlaneStop

int[] bitPlaneStop
When DCStop equals 0 indicates for each segment the bitplane where codification stops. If the value given is greater than the number of bitplanes, then the no information from encoded bitplanes will be sent.

Negatives values are not allowed

stageStop

int[] stageStop
When DCStop equals 0 indicates for each segment the generation (stage) where codification stops. If more generations than the available are required, all the generations will be encoded.

Valid values for wl DWT levels are:

  • 1 - all
  • 2 - Generation 0 (Stage 1)
  • 3 - Generation 1 (Stage 2)
  • ...
  • (wl+1) - Generation wl (Stage wl+1)

entropyAC

int[] entropyAC
Definition in EncodeGaggleAC.entropyAC

resolutionLevels

int resolutionLevels
Indicates the number of resolution levels that must be encoded, this number can be lower that the number of WTLevels

Neither negatives values nor values higher than WTLevels are allowed.

distortion

DistortionCompute distortion
This object computes the distortion when block components are encoded.

computeDistortion

boolean computeDistortion

desiredDistortion

float desiredDistortion

distortionMeasure

int distortionMeasure

progressionOrder

int progressionOrder
Definition in WriteFile.progressionOrder

run

public void run(int[] blockInSegment,
                int segmentId)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Performs the bit plane encoding and writes the coded image to an array of bits.

Parameters:
blockInSegment - definition in blockInSegment
segmentId - definition in segmentId
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and segment encoding must be stopped

getBP

public int[] getBP()
            throws ParameterException
Creates an integer array that determines for each subband the number of bitplanes that are necessary zero due the weighting stage

Returns:
an integer array that contains for each family and generation the number of bitplanes that are necessary zero due the weighting stage
Throws:
ParameterException - when the parameters are not compatible
